com.esri.mo2.svr.map
Class AcetateLayer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.svr.map.AcetateLayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
AcetateLayer
public class AcetateLayer
extends Object
implements AcetateLayer

This class provides an implementation of com.esri.mo2.map.core.AcetateLayer interface that can be added to a server Map object and managed by ServerDisplayManager through server Map. This class behaves much like the AcetateLayer defined in com.esri.mo2.ui.bean package except that the latter is a JComponent while the former is a plain Java class.

          Constructs an AcetateLayer without a Layer.

Constructor Detail

AcetateLayer

public AcetateLayer()
Constructs an AcetateLayer without a Layer. The new AcetateLayer will be invisible, as there is no Layer associated with it.

AcetateLayer

public AcetateLayer(Layer layer)
Constructs an AcetateLayer with given Layer. This constructor also sets the visibility of the Layer to true. If you want the Layer to be invisible, obtain the Layer after construction and set its visibility to False.

Parameters:
layer - the Layer
See Also:
setLayer(com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.Layer)
Method Detail

setLayer

public void setLayer(Layer layer)
Sets the Layer associated with an AcetateLayer. You can also remove its association by setting the Layer to be null. Unlike the constructor, this method makes no changes to the Layer properties.

Specified by:
setLayer in interface AcetateLayer
Parameters:
layer - the Layer
See Also:
AcetateLayer(com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.Layer)

setMap

public void setMap(Map map)
Description copied from interface: AcetateLayer
Set Map for the AcetateLayer. When the AcetateLayer is added to a Map, the Map will call this method to register itself

Specified by:
setMap in interface AcetateLayer
Parameters:
map - the Map object

getLayer

public Layer getLayer()
Returns the associated Layer.
